title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 64.7 - Documents relating to warehouse liquor must be approved by authority
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 64.7 - Documents relating to warehouse liquor must be approved by authority

State Regulations

No letterhead, order blank, invoice, sales slip, bill, contract, receipt, certificate or document relating in any way to liquor stored
in a warehouse, shall be used by any licensee holding a license pursuant to
section
61
or
62
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, or
any person holding a permit pursuant to section
93
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, in
connection with the solicitation, sale or delivery of liquor to a retail
licensee holding a license pursuant to section
63
or
64
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law, in
this State, described and identified by warehouse receipts, unless and until a
specimen of such letterhead, order blank, invoice, sales slip, bill, contract, receipt, certificate or document relating in any way to liquor stored in a
warehouse shall have been submitted to the State Liquor Authority with a
written request for approval and written approval by the authority
obtained. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
64.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
